channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: Heritage Foundation staff in open revolt over leader’s defense of Tucker Carlson
item.description: The recent departures and condemnations stemmed from increasing frustration with Kevin Roberts’s handling of Project 2025 and internal sexism allegations.

item.title: Elon Musk wins $1 trillion pay package, tying him to Tesla for a decade and setting him up to be world's first trillionaire
item.description: In an era of skyrocketing CEO pay, the award is unprecedented. The decision passed with more than 75 percent of the vote.

item.title: Federal judge orders Trump administration to release full SNAP benefits by Friday
item.description: In his ruling, Judge Jack McConnell said the USDA was causing “irreparable harm” by not releasing full funding. “The evidence shows that people will go hungry,” he added.

item.title: Congressional Budget Office believed to have been hacked by foreign actor, people familiar with the situation say
item.description: The nonpartisan office makes economic projections for lawmakers and evaluates legislation for how much it would add or subtract from the national debt. The breach potentially exposes key financial data.

item.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to end policy of self-identifying gender on passports
item.description: The justices overturned for now a lower-court decision that blocked an executive order by President Donald Trump that required passports to reflect a person’s sex as listed on their birth certificate. The decision is the latest in a string of orders by the high court rolling back gay and transgender rights.

item.title: Jury finds D.C. ‘sandwich guy’ not guilty of assaulting officer
item.description: Sean C. Dunn admitted he flung the hoagie at a federal agent. His attorneys called it a “harmless gesture” of protest as Trump commandeered D.C. police.

item.title: Virginia teacher shot by 6-year-old student wins $10 million in lawsuit against former assistant principal
item.description: Abby Zwerner was a teacher at Richneck Elementary School when she was shot by her first-grade student in 2023.

item.title: Trump announces deal to lower price of GLP-1 drugs that help with weight loss
item.description: The president announced concessions from Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk that will lower the price of the companies’ weight-loss drugs for some patients who are covered by Medicare and Medicaid.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Son’s friend goes by he/him, but his parents still use she/her
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Son’s friend goes by he/him, but his parents still use she/her

item.title: Preliminary list of airports affected by flight cuts amid shutdown includes those serving Atlanta, New York, L.A., D.C. and others
item.description:
A person briefed on the process who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss internal plans cautioned the list could change as discussions continue.
The flight reductions were announced Thursday as part of a Trump administration effort aimed at easing pressure on air traffic controllers and other aviation staff working without pay during the government shutdown.

item.title: The great GOP migration has begun, Republican Jeff Flake writes
item.description: The midterms promise a reality check — and growing defections from disastrous MAGA orthodoxy.

item.title: Cloning dogs in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Thursday points.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi announces her retirement and will wrap up her historic, almost four-decade run in Congress at the end of her term
item.description: The San Francisco Democrat, who became the first woman speaker of the House, is known for bending the chamber to her will and keeping her often narrow majority in line through a combination of persuasion and fear of punishment.

item.title: Layoffs rise to recession-like levels through October, new report says
item.description: Employers have announced 1.1 million job cuts so far this year, the highest reading since the pandemic, according to a report from Challenger, Gray & Christmas, a private firm that tracks workplace reductions.

item.title: Election fallout. Tariff doubts. Flight cuts. ICE chase. Musk payout. Think tank revolt. AI therapy. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: At 89, she’s a top nutritionist. Here’s what she eats in a day to stay healthy — and some treats she can’t resist.
item.description: Marion Nestle’s blunt advice, sharp criticism of food companies and popular books have made her one of the most recognizable names in nutrition.

item.title: Trump administration orders 10 percent reduction in flights in 40 U.S. markets as shutdown drags on
item.description: The unprecedented move, effective Friday, comes just a few weeks before the busy Thanksgiving travel period.

item.title: Supreme Court appears skeptical of Trump’s authority to impose sweeping tariffs
item.description: In oral arguments, the justices sharply questioned attorneys in the most significant case over President Donald Trump’s policies to reach the high court to date — and the first in which the justices could be called on to render a final decision.

item.title: Mapping Democrats’ sweep of Virginia, New Jersey and New York
item.description: Democrats scored major gubernatorial wins in Virginia and New Jersey and captured the New York City mayoral race as voters chose candidates who focused on affordability and capitalized on frustration with President Donald Trump. The Washington Post visualized how East Coast elections played out.

item.title: ‘I helped raise my late sister’s kids, but I got pushed out’: Carolyn Hax’s readers give advice
item.description: ‘I helped raise my late sister’s kids, but I got pushed out’: Carolyn Hax’s readers give advice

item.title: Supreme Court is hearing arguments over whether Trump has the legal authority to impose most of his sweeping tariffs
item.description: The closely watched case could have major implications for global trade, the U.S. economy and the pocketbooks of Americans.

item.title: Accumulating power in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Wednesday points.

item.title: Death toll in UPS plane crash in Louisville rises to 9
item.description: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear (D) said news of the fatalities was “heartbreaking” and that it was possible the death toll could rise further.

item.title: Five takeaways as Democrats sweep races and voters deliver a rebuke of Trump
item.description: Republicans expected a tough political environment nationwide this year as polls showed voters souring on President Donald Trump, though some had been hopeful about springing an upset or two. Democrats focused much of their marquee campaigns on the president.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani. Election takeaways. Plane crash. Shutdown record. Cancer pill. Double major. Tom Brady’s cloned dog. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: California voters approve congressional map that boosts Democrats’ chances of winning as many as five more House seats, AP projects
item.description: Voters approved a ballot measure pushed by Gov. Gavin Newsom (D), offsetting Texas’s move to redraw its own map in the GOP’s favor at President Donald Trump’s urging. The dueling moves are part of a national fight over redistricting.

item.title: Democrat Jay Jones wins Virginia attorney general seat, AP projects, overcoming his text message scandal
item.description: Jones, a former state delegate who vowed to fight Trump administration policies, won despite a scandal over violent text messages he sent in 2022 about a former GOP House speaker.

item.title: Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani wins New York mayoral race, defeating former governor Andrew Cuomo, AP projects
item.description: Mamdani, 34, will be the first Muslim mayor of the nation’s largest city. He campaigned on tackling the city’s affordability crisis and has clashed with President Donald Trump and some fellow Democrats.

item.title: Democrat Mikie Sherrill wins New Jersey governor’s race, AP projects
item.description: The congresswoman beat Republican Jack Ciattarelli in a closely watched election. New Jersey leans blue but shifted to the right last year and often has competitive contests for governor.

item.title: Democrat Ghazala Hashmi wins Virginia lieutenant governor seat, AP projects
item.description: Hashmi, a state senator, will be the first Muslim and first South Asian to hold a statewide office in Virginia.

item.title: Democrat Abigail Spanberger to become Virginia’s first female governor, AP projects
item.description: The former congresswoman and ex-CIA officer has been a centrist Democrat, focusing on pragmatic issues — such as the economy and health care — during her campaign.

item.title: Follow live: Races to decide New York mayor, Virginia and New Jersey governors, California redistricting and more are on the line
item.description: The contests offer a snapshot of voter attitudes one year after President Donald Trump was elected to return to the White House.

item.title: UPS plane crashes after takeoff at Louisville airport with three on board
item.description: Video of the incident shows UPS Flight 2976 ablaze and flying at a low altitude shortly before crashing, producing a fiery explosion that sent a plume of black smoke into the air.

item.title: Messages sent from the Trump administration suggest that furloughed workers may not be paid after the shutdown ends
item.description: The Trump administration is sending notifications to federal staff suggesting only those who are working during the government shutdown will be paid when it ends, despite a 2019 law that guarantees pay to furloughed employees, too.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: How long should you date someone who’s only ‘good on paper’?
item.description: Carolyn Hax: How long should you date someone who’s only ‘good on paper’?

item.title: The real truth about the Tudor succession comes to light. Literally.
item.description: The transition to the Stuart dynasty after Elizabeth I’s death was neither smooth nor peaceful.

item.title: The secretive donor circle that lifted JD Vance is now re-writing MAGA’s future
item.description: Chris Buskirk put tech elites at the center of power in President Donald Trump’s Washington. His efforts are grounded in a controversial theory — an “aristocracy” is needed to move the country forward.

item.title: It's Election Day in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points.

item.title: Election Day. Dick Cheney. Inflation blame. Billionaire network. Israeli leak. Step count. Pokémon thefts. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Dick Cheney dies at 84. As vice president from 2001-2009, he set the nation’s course as none in his role had done before.
item.description:
After the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, Republican Richard B. “Dick” Cheney became chief architect of a “war on terrorism” that involved bypassing restrictions against torture and domestic espionage.
In his later years, he spoke out against the abuse of presidential power by Donald Trump.

item.title: What it’s like to cross an ocean on the only remaining passenger ship of its kind
item.description: The Queen Mary 2 keeps a romantic age of transatlantic sailing alive.

item.title: The biggest careers that have now vanished, by the numbers
item.description: The Department of Data started spelunking through archaic occupations in search of disappearing jobs — but it turns out the best answer is more obvious than you think.

item.title: Laura Loomer, a far-right political activist, is now credentialed to cover the Pentagon
item.description: The former congressional candidate has frustrated some in the Trump administration with her close ties to the president and her public criticism of high-ranking defense and national security officials she argues are disloyal — some of whom were dismissed soon after her rebukes. She joins a new cohort of right-wing media that have agreed to the Pentagon’s new press policy.

item.title: Diane Ladd, the Oscar-nominated, multifaceted character actress, dies at 89
item.description: She received the highest praise for her performances in “Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore,” “Wild at Heart” and “Rambling Rose.” Her daughter Laura Dern followed her into acting.

item.title: Trump administration says it is paying out half of November’s SNAP benefits
item.description: The administration said that it will release enough funds to pay for a half-month’s worth of food assistance benefits in November, days after two courts ordered the U.S. Department of Agriculture to release the money to avoid forcing nearly 42 million Americans into food insecurity.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: She can’t unsee it now — she’s always wrong in her husband’s eyes
item.description: Carolyn Hax: She can’t unsee it now — she’s always wrong in her husband’s eyes

item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s success is a warning, the Editorial Board writes
item.description: How did a socialist with almost no governing experience become New York’s mayoral frontrunner?

item.title: Ticket sales are down in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Monday points.

item.title: Climate change is supercharging extreme rainfall. See if you live in a hotspot.
item.description: A Post investigation reveals where hidden rivers in the sky are making rainfall more dangerous worldwide.

item.title: Trump polls. Zohran Mamdani. Shutdown impacts. Heavy rainfall. Melatonin study. Disappearing jobs. Pickleball noise. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.
